    Choosing the value of alpha Simulate correlated and ordered categorical data

    Choosing the value of alpha

    choose-alpha.Rmd

    Currently, the model cannot estimate the value of alpha with the rest of the parameters, and thus, must be fixed previously. Usually, we do not know the true value of alpha, and we need a good estimation for it. The package psych provides an estimation for this parameter in the polychoric function.

    library(fatcat)
#> Loading required package: RcppTN
library(psych)
    alpha = polychoric(t(ordered_data$y))$tau
alpha = cbind(-Inf, alpha, Inf)

    With the estimate for the alpha matrix, we can fit the model.

    set.seed(1)
res <- fitfatcat(
  ordered_data$y,
  q = 2,
  alpha = alpha, 
  nit = 10000,
  lag = 9,
  burnin = 1000, 
  quiet = TRUE
)
    bayesplot::mcmc_trace(res, regex = "beta")

    bayesplot::mcmc_trace(res, pars = dplyr::vars(dplyr::num_range("f_1", 1:5)))

    bayesplot::mcmc_trace(res, regex = "sigma2")
